intro: Valerianella radiata var. missouriensis, commonly known as Missouri valley grass, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and roadsides. It is often found in open habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in wet conditions. Valerianella radiata var. missouriensis is an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small mammals.
